Waspada Pergerakan Tanah, Warga Cikupa Diungsikan
06 Nov 2019, 04:51 by Ahmad Rayadie
PALABUHANRATU, (PR).- Petugas Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah (BPBD) Kabupaten Sukabumi, Rabu, 6 November 2019, mengimbau agar warga di Kampung Cikupa RT 22/03, Desa Pagelaran, Kecamatan Purabaya, Kabupaten Sukabumi waspada. Bahkan dibantu personil tentara, polisi dan warga, para relawan telah mengevakuasi tujuh dari tiga puluh tiga kepala keluaga warga yang terancam mengungsi.
Pergerakan tanah telah berlangsung kurang dari sepekan ini, dan puncaknya pasca hujan mengguyur Sukabumi dikhawatirkan meluas. Potensi pergerakan yang kini tidak hanya merusakan rumah warga. 
Pergerakan tanah juga menyebabkan sarana jalan penghubung rusak berat.  Akibatnya, jalan kini tidak bisa dilalui berbagai jenis kendaraan roda dua dan empat. Begitupun lahan persawahan yang mencapai 1.600 meter amblas.
"Bahkan akibat pergerakan tanah, menyebabkan rumah warga rusak berat dan ringan. Sementara warga yang diperkirakan mencapai dua puluh tiga jiwa diimbau mengungsi," kata warga, Suhendi.
Petugas Penanggulangan Bencana Kecamatan Cibadak (P2BK), Daming Supriyatna mengatakan telah melakukukan koordinasi dan Assesment ke TKK. Didamping pemerintah desa Karangtengah, Mapolsek dan Koramil Cibadak,  Pol PP kecamatan Cibadak dan pramuka peduli telah.mengirimkan personil membantu warga.
"Pergerakan tanah dipicu hujan deras dan mengibatkan terputusnya jalan penghubung Kampung Sindangresmi menuju Kampung Porki. Jalan sepanjang 30 meter dan kedalaman 8 meter amblas," katanya.
Koordinator Pusat Pengendalian.dan Operasional, Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah (BPBD) Kabupaten Sukabumi, Daeng Sutisna mengatakan telah menurunkan petugas Penanggulangan Bencana Kecamatan Cibadak (P2BK) untuk melakukan pendataan. Bahkan petugas untuk seksama memantau  lokasi pergerakan tanah secara intensif.
"Setelah mendapat laporan, petugas tidak hanya.membantu proses evakuasi dibantu personil kecamatan dan warga. Tapi memantau untuk  mengantisipasi bencana susulan," katanya.***

Beware of Land Movement, Cikupa Residents Evacuated
Nov 6 2019, 04:51 by Ahmad Rayadie
PALABUHANRATU, (PR) .- Officials of the Regional Disaster Management Agency (BPBD) of Sukabumi Regency, Wednesday, November 6, 2019, appealed for residents in the Cikupa Village RT 22/03, Pagelaran Village, Purabaya District, Sukabumi District to be alert. Even assisted by army personnel, police and residents, volunteers have evacuated seven of thirty-three family heads of residents who are threatened with evacuation.
The ground movement has been going on for less than a week now, and the peak after the rain flushed Sukabumi is feared to spread. The potential for movement is now not only damaging residents' homes.
Ground movement also causes the connecting road facilities to be severely damaged. As a result, the road is now impassable to various types of two-and four-wheeled vehicles. Likewise, paddy fields reaching 1,600 meters have collapsed.
"In fact, due to the movement of the land, the residents' homes were severely and lightly damaged. Meanwhile, residents estimated to reach twenty-three people were advised to flee," said resident Suhendi.
The Cibadak District Disaster Management Officer (P2BK), Daming Supriyatna, said that he had done coordination and assessment to TKK. In addition to the Karangtengah village government, Mapolsek and Cibadak Koramil, PP PP Cibadak sub-district and scout carers have sent personnel to help residents.
"The movement of the land was triggered by heavy rains and resulted in the interruption of the connecting road of Kampung Sindangresmi towards Kampung Porki. The road along the 30 meters and a depth of 8 meters collapsed," he said.
The Coordinator of the Center for Operational Control and Operations, the Regional Disaster Management Agency (BPBD) of Sukabumi Regency, Daeng Sutisna said that it had sent Cibadak District Disaster Management (P2BK) officers to collect data. Even officers to closely monitor the location of land movements intensively.
"After receiving the report, the officers not only assisted the evacuation process assisted by sub-district personnel and residents. But monitored to anticipate aftershocks," he said. ***
